resource.name: Hackathon: Recycling Tip Data (2019-2022)
resource.description:
Date Range: August 2019 - November 2022
66,717 rows dropped due to incomplete data from RFID reader (2% of total rows in data set)

This data comes from RFID readers on recycling trucks that scan recycling carts which contain a unique RFID tag on each cart. Every time an RFID tag is read by the recycling truck a row is recorded in the data set. The account number in the data set is the account number that the cart belongs to. Each account number may have a varying number of carts. 

The account number used by the recycling company is also an ID used in our databases for referring to addresses. In our address database each record has an account number (aka address_guid) and an addressid. The important thing to note is that some addressid's may have multiple account numbers (aka addr_guid's). For example, some condo complexes have an account number (aka addr_guid) for every unit in the complex. This does not mean that every building with multiple units will have multiple account numbers for each addressid.

The columns that contain information on the type of residence the address is have data that was pulled in November 2022. This may have implications when looking at historical data structure types. For example, an account number was a one family dwelling in 2019 but remodeled and reclassified as a 4-family dwelling in 2022. The records where this is the case however should be small.

The dataset contains tips from all recycling accounts, so commercial and municipal account tips will also appear in the dataset. This will need to be accounted for when analyzing and filters may need to be applied to look at specific groups such as residential single family dwellings.
 
Column Info:
ADDR_TYPE:
ADR = Address
BLD = Building
PAR = Parcel
CON = CONDO

Category:
Specifies if the address is classified as "Residential" or "Commercial" use for example.

Description:
A more granular description of the address for example Category could be "Residential" and Description could be "Single Family Dwelling"
columns_description: The serial number of the cart that was read by the recycling truck. This is unique for each cart.
The RFID tag number read by the recycling truck. This is unique for each recycling cart.
The size of the recycling cart that was tipped.

The latitude the tip was read at. This will be different from the address_latitude column. For example, if the cart is at the end of a long driveway, the latitude of the tip will be at the end of the driveway while the latitude of the address will be at the center of the building.

The longitude the tip was read at. This will be different from the address_longitude column. For example, if the cart is at the end of a long driveway, the longitude of the tip will be at the end of the drive way while the longitude of the address will be the center of the building.
The identifier of the truck that performed the tip.
The category of the parcel according to auditor land use code data.
The description of the parcel according to the auditor land use code data.
The Statistical Neighborhood Approximation neighborhood. Generated by seeing which polygon in a shape file the address latitude and longitude point fall in.
The collection route number identifier that the tip was a part of.
The type of service of the tip. In this dataset, they will all be recycling.
The date the tip occured. All times will be 12 AM
The id of the address. Multiple account numbers can be associated with a single addressid.
The classification of the address. For example: "BLD" = Building, "PAR" = Parcel,
A point generated by using address latitude and longitude.
The unique id for the recycling participant. One address can have multiple of these if the address has multiple recycling accounts.

resource.name: City of Cincinnati Garbage Routes
columns_description: Street number of addres
Address unique id
Unique ID to Dataset
Day trash is picked up
Neighborhood of address
Coded route name based upon day trash is picked up
Street on which trash is picked up
type of street
Name of street
Street direction (N/S/E/W)
Address
